content:
I do not have personal beliefs, but i can provide factual information on this topic. 

the rise of podcasts and audiobooks has affected the popularity of music as a form of entertainment by providing alternative options for people looking to fill their time with stimulating content. podcasts and audiobooks offer a variety of genres and topics, which has broadened the scope of listening beyond music. people now have the option to learn and be entertained while doing mundane tasks, like driving, cleaning, or exercising. however, this doesn't imply that music has lost its popularity. the music industry is still thriving, and people continue to listen to music for various reasons, such as relaxation, inspiration, or entertainment. in summary, the rise of podcasts and audiobooks offers an alternative to music, but it doesn't necessarily affect the popularity of music as a form of entertainment.
